summary: This document contains email correspondence and multiple Deutsche Bank authorization forms dated January 21, 2014, directing wire transfers and asset movements from accounts belonging to Jeffrey E. Epstein. The forms authorize transfers to entities including JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America, TD Bank, and MC2 Model Management, and include a memorandum for a wire to a beneficiary named Bella Klein.

events.title: Authorization of Multiple Financial Transfers
events.description: Harry Beller signs multiple Deutsche Bank forms authorizing wire transfers, check issuance, and security deliveries from Jeffrey Epstein's accounts to various banks and entities including JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America, TD Bank, and MC2 Model Management.

events.title: Wire Transfer to Bella Klein
events.description: A memorandum from Harry Beller to Amanda Kirby instructs a wire of 5,000 Euros from a specified Epstein account, with Bella Klein listed as the contact for questions.

keyFacts: On January 21, 2014, Harry Beller authorized multiple asset movements from Jeffrey Epstein's Deutsche Bank accounts.
The authorized transfers included wires to major banks (JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America, TD Bank) and an entity called MC2 Model Management.
A separate memorandum authorized a wire of 5,000 Euros, with instructions to contact a beneficiary named Bella Klein for questions.
The authorization forms granted Deutsche Bank the ability to accept verbal instructions from the signatory for future transactions, creating a standing authorization.
The documents are marked as confidential pursuant to Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 6(e), indicating they were part of a grand jury investigation.
